results.title: Solving work problems (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a hree step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.

results.title: Solving the problem (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The final step in the process of performance appraisal is reaching a solution relevant to the problem and its cause which involves considering realistic options, agreeing on a clear action plan and setting a review date to ensure the plan is working.

results.title: Solutions: ionic and molecular. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Illustrates the chemical nature of a solution, what happens when it forms and the role of the electrostatic forces. Shows Brownian movement, defines saturation and presents the concept of molarity along with an explanation of why some substances, eg oil, won’t dissolve in other substances such as water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Solutions to pollution
results.brief_description: An introduction to some possible solutions to air, water, and noise pollution. Stresses conservation of resources, particularly at community level. Could be used to stimulate further in-depth discussion on some of the answers it provides. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Solutions
results.brief_description: Examples of the price we pay in our deteriorating environment for the misuse of road traffic. In contrast we see the modern railway system offering an already existing solution to our crowded island’s transport problems. A film without commentary.

results.title: Solomon Islands regain independence
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: On July 7, 1978, Solomon Islands regained its independence from Britain. Looks at the people of these islands and studies their way of life through their comments, songs and dances. Describes the problems facing the new nation and what is being done to combat them. Pidgin dialogue, English dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Solo
results.creator_credit: Mike Hoover, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Mike Hoover as the climber portrays the efforts and exhilarations that are experienced by the solo mountain climber. Filmed in Mexico, the United States and Canada on 21 different climbs this story explores the pleasures and dangers of mountain climbing by presenting three aspects of climbing of which the non-climber is rarely aware. These are the driving rhythm of sustained physical effort, the discovery of scenes and weathers unknown to others and the commitment to challenges which must be met alone.

results.title: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton's laws of motion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Millington, Barrie Whatley, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Experimental evidence for Newton’s laws of motion is examined and a number of experiments are demonstrated to show the effect of forces on a massive concrete sphere. Illustrates concepts like kinetic and potential energy, compressional energy and the behaviour of matter in a force free environment
